page.title: 15CUMBLE TOR - TREMATON
page.content: Cumble Tor is a farm of some 130 acres standing near the village of Trematon. It overlooks the River Lynher and has been in the hands of the same family for hundreds of years. Most of the present barns were once used as the farm house or as workers cottages, and there are the remains of at least one {clombe oven}in one of these barns. The previous farm house was built in 1840 by a member of the same family as the present owners. Cumble Tor is a farm with a long history. It is described by the owners as a farm of yesterday and a farm of tomorrow. The farm is reached by a single broken track, Cumble Tor Lane which passes between fields of Barley fodder and rough grazing. This is a mixed farm, with 50 sheep and 100 cattle as well as market garden crops and cereals.
